TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ModelItem extends System.Object implements class System.ComponentModel.INotifyPropertyChanged

Docs.summary: Represents a single item in the editing model. An item can be anything from a complex data structure down to a color or integer.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Creates a new instance of the class.
Gets the attributes declared on this item.
Docs.value: A collection that contains the attributes of the item.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelEditingScope BeginEdit() cil managed

Docs.summary: Opens an editing scope for the designer. After an editing scope is open, all changes across all objects will be saved into the scope until the transaction is completed or reverted. Editing scopes can be nested, but must be committed in order.
Docs.returns: A , which must be either completed or reverted.

remarks.format:
## Remarks An editing scope allows multiple changes to the model to be applied as a single transaction. All of the changes made within the editing scope can be reverted at any time before the transaction is completed.
Editing scopes are global to the designer. An editing scope can be created for any item in the designer; you do not need to create an editing scope for the specific item you are changing.

Editing scopes are global to the designer. An editing scope can be created for any item in the designer; you do not need to create an editing scope for the specific item you are changing.

Docs.summary: Gets the of the item, or .
Docs.value: The of the item as a . If the is not declared by the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem.ItemType%2A> of this item, Content returns .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetCurrentValue() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns the current value of the underlying model object that the is wrapping.
Docs.returns: The current value of the underlying model object that the is wrapping as an <xref:System.Object>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks You can inspect this object, but you should not make any changes to it. Changes made to the object returned will not be incorporated into the designer. The GetCurrentValue method can return either an existing or new cloned instance of the object.

Docs.summary: Gets the type of object that the item represents.
Docs.value: The type of object that the item represents.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract string Name { get; set; }

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name or ID of the item.
Docs.value: The name or ID of the item as a <xref:System.String>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Not all items need to have names, so this might return `null`. Depending on the type of item and where it sits in the hierarchy, it might not always be legal to set the Name on an item. If the <xref:System.Activities.Presentation.Model.ModelItem.ItemType%2A> of this item declares a `RuntimeNamePropertyAttribute`, the Name property is a direct mapping to the property dictated by that attribute.

Docs.summary: Gets the item that is the parent of this item.
Docs.value: A that is the parent of this item. If an item is contained in a collection or dictionary, the object that owns the collection or dictionary is returned instead.

Docs.summary: Gets all parents of this item.
Gets the public properties on this item.
Docs.value: A that contains the public properties of this item.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The set of properties returned might change based on attached properties or changes to the editing scope.

Docs.summary: Implements . Use this event to listen for changes to the model. This is also used by the data binding features of WPF.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Disconnect events from items when you are finished with them. Otherwise, you might prevent the garbage collector from disposing of an item that is no longer in use.

Docs.summary: Gets the item that is the root of this tree.
Docs.value: A that is the root of this tree, or if this item is not part of a tree.

Docs.summary: Gets the property that provided this value.
Docs.value: A that indicates the source of this value.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the item represents the root of the object graph, this will return `null`. If an item is a member of a collection or dictionary, the property returned from Source will be a pseudo-property provided by the collection or dictionary. For other values, the Source property returns the property where the value was actually set. Therefore, if a value is being inherited, Source allows you to find out who originally provided the value.

Docs.summary: Gets all the properties that hold this value.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance string ToString() cil managed

Docs.summary: Returns a string representation of the underlying model object contained in this model item.
Docs.returns: A string representation of the underlying model object contained in this model item.

Docs.summary: Gets a that graphically represents this item.
Docs.value: A that graphically represents this item, or if there is no such representation.
